conclusion: Analyze forces on block A in both scenarios to determine friction force at 30°.
Block A is on an inclined plane at 37° in Figure A.
Block A and cylinder B are on an inclined plane at 30° in Figure B.
Gravitational force on block A is Mg.
Parallel component of gravitational force at 37° is Mg sin(37°).
Perpendicular component of gravitational force at 37° is Mg cos(37°).
Friction force balances parallel component at 37°, f = Mg sin(37°).
Friction force at 37° is f = Mg × 0.6.
Gravitational force on block A is still Mg at 30°.
Parallel component of gravitational force at 30° is Mg sin(30°).
Perpendicular component of gravitational force at 30° is Mg cos(30°).
Friction force balances parallel component at 30°, f = Mg sin(30°).
Friction force at 30° is f = Mg × 0.5.
Substitute M in friction force equation, f = 4mg × 0.5.
Final answer: Friction force of block A on the slope at 30° is 2mg.
